text:
CCU Nursing Progress Note
   (7p-7a)
   This is a 43 yr old with h/o anterior MI
[**92**], ischemic dilated CM, EF
   20% presents with firing of AICD several times at home and s/p
passing
   out
 at home at 1p and then feeling firing of ICD at 6p. He was
   admitted to [**Hospital1 54**] via ER for these events on day of admission.
   [**9-20**]- Pt was sent to EP  for VT ablation, c/b PEA arrest.( ? possible
   clot/PE). Procedure aborted and pt coded- reportedly CPR x 30 minutes.
   Pt vented, sedated and IABP. Noted to have distended abdomen- (+)
   pancreatic by lab results. NPO/ OGT to intermittent sx.
   [**9-21**] Pressors then IABP weaned and d/c
d. Sheath pulled late afternoon
   w small hematoma- Pt remains sedated on propofol, unable to determine
   CIWA scale. ECHO revealing EF- 20% w large mural thrombus. Pt scheduled
   and sent to CT to r/o thrombus/emboli to head- preliminary results (-).
   Hemodynamics WNL off pressors/IABP.
   [**9-22**]-Given valium 5mg po this morning( for CIWA/ possible withdrawal
   ETOH) while weaning propofol after discussion with CCU team. Propofol
   off since 130pm
 pt only opening eyes but not blinking
to threat
   focusing or tracking. No movement of arms or legs. Pt remains on PS 5/5
   40%. Pt not extubated  due to poor mental status.  Temp spike 101
 pan
   cultured. Started on Vanco/Zosyn for (+) sputum/urine results. Several
   episodic NSVT on evenings and one longer run at rate 220
s which
   resulted in self firing of ICD successfully out of tachyrhythym. Given
   15 mg IV lopressor and increased PO dose. Plan is to start AMIO IV per
   EP fellow if continues to have further VT runs. To obtain neuro consult
   in AM if mental status remains unchanged/ and  if pt does not wake up
   significantly.
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Pt admitted s/p PEA arrest/ requiring intubation/code- currently
   spiking temps w (+) sputum/urine specimens
   Action:
   Pt pan cultured earlier Wed- sent additional sputum/urine to clarify
   questionable findings/fine tune antibx coverage. Started on
   vanco/zosyn. Tylenol started prn as well.
   Response:
   T max- 99.4-8. No fever this shift. Given tylenol x 2 doses. 2^nd
   sputum/urine specimen pending.
   Plan:
   Continue antibx as ordered. Keep afebrile w tylenol as needed. Await
   further info from cultures already sent to lab.
   .H/O alcohol abuse
   Assessment:
   Pt admitted to [**Hospital1 54**] for EPS- reportedly s/p large ETOH ingestion
   Saturday, unknown Sunday
s consumption. Currently on CIWA scale to
   assess more closely. Pt off all sedation but remains not alert/awake
   enough to follow commands, thus requiring continuation of intubation
   for airway protection.
   Action:
   CIWA scale observed. Valium IV PRN ordered. No valium given d/t current
   level of sedation/ no sz activity visible, no evidence of ETOH
   withdrawal. Remains without purposeful response or following commands
   off all sedation.
   Of note- pt is s/p CT scan [**9-22**] nite to r/o embolic event to head in
   setting of known large CV clot by ECHO- by report results were (-).
   Response:
   See above- no evidence of ETOH withdrawal currently. No benzo
s given
   this shift.
   Plan:
   Continue to closely observe for ETOH withdrawal. Plan to consult neuro
   today to better assess neuro status s/p CPR/Code/PEA arrest in pt that
   is not fully waking up s/p d/c of all sedation.
   Ventricular tachycardia, non-sustained (NSVT)
   Assessment:
   Pt s/p several episodes of VT/ICD firing- admitted to [**Hospital1 **] via ER for
   EPS. Pt developing PEA arrest during study/resulting in
   code/intubation/pressors/IABP.
   Action:
   Pt
s hemodynamics remain stable off all pressors/IABP. Issue this shift
   of pt developing runs of NSVT.  ICD firing x 1 this shift, when rate >
   200 for moderately long run( see strips). Pt has had episodic NS runs
   VT 4-8 beats without further firing of ICD, spontaneously converting
   back to ST. Given 15 mg total IVP lopressor, remains on lopressor tid.
   Given AM dose early per HO. Checked AM lytes early . given tylenol in
   attempts to bring down HR as well , in spite of pt being low grade, not
   febrile this shift.
   Response:
   See above. No further sustained runs VT or firing of ICD this shift.
   Lytes all WNL currently.
   Plan:
   Continue to follow closely- discuss plan w EP re: restarting AMIO
   gtt/bolus( had been on s/p PEA code in EP lab transiently). Continue to
   closely follow for any further firing- appropriate or inappropriate- of
   ICD.
   Keep lytes WNL. Keep family aware of plan of care/current progress.
